chat.common

Class Scenario

  • java.lang.Object
    • chat.common.Scenario

  • public abstract class Scenario
extends Object
    This abstract class defines the way integration tests can be written for instanciating several clients and several servers in the same virtual machine and for executing a sequence of actions in response to user inputs (e.g. chat message on clients or command lines on servers) and to messages received from the network.
    Author:
    Denis Conan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scenario()
      constructs a scenario, that is initialize the data structures.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scenario

    • Method Detail

      • instanciateAClient

        public Client instanciateAClient(int serverPortNb)
                          throws UnknownHostException
        instanciates a client. To match the arguments of the constructor of a client, the server host name is localhost.
        Parameters:
        serverPortNb - the port number of the server to connect to.
        Returns:
        the reference to the new client.
        Throws:
        UnknownHostException - the exception thrown in case network configuration problem.

      • emulateAnInputLineFromTheConsoleForAClient

        public void emulateAnInputLineFromTheConsoleForAClient(Client client,
                                                       String inputLine)
                                                throws IOException
        emulates the treatment of keyboard entries.
        Parameters:
        client - the reference to the client.
        inputLine - the line inputed.
        Throws:
        IOException - the exception thrown when a communication problem occurs during the exchanges with the server due to the keyboard entries.

      • instanciateAServer

        public Server instanciateAServer(String args)
        instanciates a server. For the sake of simplicity, the arguments are similar to the ones of the constructor: the string value localhost must be provided for every neighbouring server to which the new server connects to.
        Parameters:
        args - the argument of the server as written when starting the server in a separate process: <server number> <list of pairs hostname servernumber>.
        Returns:
        the new server.

      • emulateAnInputLineFromTheConsoleForAServer

        public void emulateAnInputLineFromTheConsoleForAServer(Server server,
                                                       String inputLine)
        emulates the treatment of keyboard entries.
        Parameters:
        server - the reference to the server.
        inputLine - the line inputed.

      • constructAndRun

        public abstract void constructAndRun()
                              throws Exception
        constructs and run the scenario. NB: for now, we do not separate the sequence of actions that create clients and servers from the sequence of actions that exercise the algorithms.
        Throws:
        Exception - exception thrown when executing the scenario under test.

      • sleep

        public void sleep(long millis)
        is a utility method to encapsulate Thread.sleep with an log message in case of an InterruptedException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        millis - the timeout duration in milliseconds.
